description._content: Title: Grotto Geyser. Alternative Title: The Grotto in eruption Creator: Jackson, William Henry, 1843-1942 Date: ca. 1871-1875 Part Of: Les geysers d'Amerique Description: This image is page 19 of an album that includes 26 photographs of Yellowstone geysers made by William Henry Jackson in 1871 and 1872, while the Geological and Geographical Survey of the Territories surveyed Yellowstone. "The Grotto in eruption, throwing an immense body of water, but not more than forty feet in height. The great amount of steam given off almost entirely conceals the jets of water." (Entry in the Descriptive catalogue of the photographs of the United States Geological Survey of the Territories, Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1874, p. 32). Physical Description: 1 photographic print; albumen; 16.8 x 22.5 cm. on 27 x 35 cm. mount Form/Genre: Photographs; Photographic prints; Albumen prints; Landscape photographs; Photograph albums File: ag1982_0124x_19_grotto_geyser_opt.jpg Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/wes,352 View U.S. West: Photographs, Manuscripts, and Imprints at: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/wes/
